title: Bankrupt GDC Can Tap  Emergency Financing  ----  By Aisha Al-Muslim
text:
The bankrupt Air Force One supplier GDC Technics LLC has won court approval to borrow up to $800,000 in emergency financing and use cash pledged as collateral, despite objections by the company's former partner, Boeing Co.

Judge Craig A. Gargotta of the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in San Antonio said during a hearing that he would sign an order authorizing GDC to access up to an additional $300,000 in bankruptcy financing from Mazav Management LLC, an indirect owner of GDC through GDC's parent Oriole Aviation LLC.

It is GDC's "intent not to borrow any more money than absolutely needed," the company's bankruptcy lawyer, Jason Rudd, said.
